pattern.name: Time day part
pattern.description:
Identify, whether it's working hour, morning, evening or night.
If the temporal attribute does not contain time part (i.e. is a date), then the pattern fails.
Note: Could just return hour (but then it would double direct_time_part).
pattern.example: Newspapers are commonly sold in the morning.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT @base , CASE WHEN hour < 5 THEN 'night' WHEN hour < 9 THEN 'morning' WHEN hour < 18 THEN 'working' WHEN hour < 21 THEN 'evening' ELSE 'night' END AS @columnName FROM ( SELECT @base , { fn HOUR(@timeColumn)} AS hour FROM @propagatedTable ) t

SELECT @base , CASE WHEN hour < 5 THEN 'night' WHEN hour < 9 THEN 'morning' WHEN hour < 18 THEN 'working' WHEN hour < 21 THEN 'evening' ELSE 'night' END AS @columnName FROM ( SELECT @base , EXTRACT(HOUR FROM @timeColumn) AS hour FROM @propagatedTable ) t
